383dc8c5-172e-46ba-a470-7cc4389beb13: A bloody bones beast applies its {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier to its {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and on Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} as a profane {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}.
d148199b-b2a6-4739-81fb-5f415b8b7d72:
A brass golem is immune to any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} that allows {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.
In addition, certain spells and effects function differently against it, as noted below.
A magical attack that deals cold damage slows a brass golem (as per the slow spell) for 1d6 rounds, with no saving throw.
A magical attack that deals fire damage breaks any slow effect on the golem and heals 4d8+20 points of damage.
9bae389b-423e-43c7-a6a1-104572f46fb3:
A clay golem is immune to any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} that allows {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.
In addition, certain spells and effects function differently against it, as noted below.
A disintegrate spell slows the golem (as per the slow spell) for 1d6 rounds with no saving throw, and deals 1d12 points of damage.
Any magical attack against a clay golem that deals acid damage heals 4d8+20 points of damage.
46605f68-fa1a-4902-8c16-282d794448bc:
A creature affected by Valmallos's Adamantine Seal resembles more of a construct and less of itself, and thus gains most of the constructs' immunities.
It gains immunity to mind-affecting effects, disease and critical hits. It also gains a +6 sacred bonus to all ability scores, immunity to magic, spell turning, and hardness 30.
The creature's attacks always deal 50 divine damage.
The creature can cast the following spells: petrify, chain lightning, disintegrate, prediction of failure, zero state, freezing nothingness.
c01faa1b-0c7f-4aa2-92a3-5707816b5fdd: A creature hit by a vampire spawn's slam (or other {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g}) gains one negative level. This ability only triggers once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, regardless of the number of {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} a vampire spawn makes.
fe49e962-096b-47e6-b403-6737dd03c083: A creature hit by a vampire's {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g} gains one negative level.
ad5e639d-6731-47c7-8cd6-db98c22b568c: A creature with ferocity remains conscious and can continue fighting even if its hit point total is below 0. The creature is still staggered and loses 1 hit point each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A creature with ferocity still dies when its hit point total reaches a negative amount equal to its {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score.
e0e20203-2442-464c-87af-7be3736ff98c: A creature with the cold subtype has immunity to cold and vulnerability to fire.
d2aa77cf-6c63-4e19-b273-9a20aba26247: A creature with the fire subtype has immunity to fire and vulnerability to cold.
8f6897a0-49a3-429b-be02-9d245b87402f: A creature with the trip special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} can attempt to trip its opponent as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} without provoking an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} if it hits with the specified attack. If the attempt fails, the creature is not tripped in return.
ec05b892-b7f0-48a2-85aa-e428db661870: A creature with {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}energy immunity{/g} never takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from that energy type.
64c269fd-ddf2-43ef-9a16-12cf09afa895: A creature with {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}energy immunity{/g} never takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from that energy type.
1db73bd3-b557-4a11-8aa1-12ac82c14bc8: A creature with {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}energy immunity{/g} never takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from that energy type.
3305277e-d093-4e57-a30f-a9b4fdf3544b: A creature with {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}energy immunity{/g} never takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from that energy type.
ed266e61-cc17-443e-b6ad-6d381832c7ce: A creature with {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}energy immunity{/g} never takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from that energy type.
3419e5c6-ec04-4e1a-b502-47a333b166b0:
A gold golem is immune to any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} that allows {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.
In addition, certain spells and effects function differently against it, as noted below.
A magical attack that deals cold damage slows a gold golem for 1d6 rounds as per the spell slow, with no saving throw.
A magical attack that deals fire damage reduces the golem's DR to 5/adamantine but also hastens it for 1d6 rounds as per the spell haste, with no saving throw.
b518f690-9f7b-4ca3-9c01-09794f019762: A nereid adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} as a deflection bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} if she wears no armor.
95023ae7-2734-46a6-bbd1-d74537c20230: A protean's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. This grants it a 50% chance to ignore additional damage caused by critical hits and sneak attacks, and grants it immunity to polymorph effects (unless the protean is a willing target).
afcc3059-0c17-45d0-81da-c8c42628f9a8: A psychopomp notices, locates, and can distinguish between living and undead creatures within 60 feet, just as if it possessed the blindsight ability.
1fd82fdb-98a5-4c53-8dfb-7a1131cdc0a4: A redcap wears a tiny, shapeless woolen hat, dyed over and over with the blood of its victims. While wearing this cap, a redcap gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} and fast {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} 3. These benefits are lost if the cap is removed or destroyed. Caps are not transferable, even between redcaps. A redcap can create a new cap to replace a lost cap with 10 minutes of work, although until the redcap takes a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to dip the cap in the blood of a foe the redcap helped to kill, the cap does not grant its bonuses.
217d3a01-1756-4df2-a4c2-40dab809b945: A vampire can crush a humanoid opponent's will as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. Anyone the vampire targets must succeed on a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} or fall instantly under the vampire's influence, as though by a dominate person {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} 12th). The ability has a range of 30 feet.
2fb6dba2-abd0-46d5-aaab-189123cbc284: Ability to overcome the undead's immunity to the mind-affecting effects.
f4aadfb4-8a80-4bba-beeb-c298725b109e: Aeons are a {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} of neutral outsiders who roam the planes maintaining the balance of reality.
74317070-685a-49e7-b8ad-5ae34315bd64: All damage this object takes is reduced by 10. Additionally, damage from ranged attacks and energy damage is halved before this reduction is applied.
9272f0e8-77b4-449e-876c-667e8c2d2f53: All demodands gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. In addition, any attempts to scry on a demodand using divine magic automatically fail. The caster can see the scryed area normally, but the demodand simply does not appear.
7179625e-3fff-4a36-8bef-da9c10328f65: All incoming physical damage is reduced by 10.
7c40ab74-f791-4474-a7f3-89823abc3852: All incoming physical damage is reduced by 20.
53464be1-5c87-4afc-9e0f-4f416d3f7aaa: All incoming physical damage is reduced by 30.
399b2a00-5de3-4457-af32-ad8bcd108b8a: An Anomaly creature gets a +10 anomaly bonus to Constitution, a +6 anomaly bonus to Strength, a +8 anomaly bonus to Dexterity, a +4 anomaly bonus to Intelligence, a +8 anomaly bonus to Wisdom and a +6 anomaly bonus to Charisma ability scores. It also gains a +5 natural armor bonus to AC. Creature's hit points increase by 2×CR×CR. No matter who this creature was, it now gains 5 outsider levels and protean's traits. In addition, the creature gains one of 5 unique defensive abilities and Anomaly Distortion ability. If that creature can cast spells, it also gains access to the anomaly spell. The subject is protected from all abilities and spells that gather information about the target through divination magic (such as see invisibility, thoughtsense and true seeing).
e4f4c235-cbef-4f9d-931e-c917ba459048: An Anomaly creature gets a +4 anomaly bonus to Constitution and Dexterity ability scores. It gains a +10 profane bonus on attack rolls. No matter who this creature was, it now gains outsider type and all protean's traits. In addition, the creature gains unique defensive ability Thundering Shield and Anomaly Distortion ability. Finally, the creature gains the following feats: Point-Blank Master (heavy crossbow, longbow, shortbow), Precise Shot, Improved Precise Shot, Snap Shot, Improved Snap Shot, Greater Snap Shot.
4b8be252-32f8-42d6-a44b-44f6ba6e2da6: An Anomaly creature gets a +4 anomaly bonus to Constitution and Strength ability scores. It gains a +10 profane bonus on attack rolls. No matter who this creature was, it now gains outsider type and all protean's traits. In addition, the creature gains the unique defensive ability Anomaly Shift and Anomaly Distortion ability. Finally, the creature gains the following feats: Outflank, Combat Mobility, Critical Focus, Hammer the Gap.
3a605f0a-9c3a-4bec-a233-e4b5175c7ea2: An Anomaly creature gets a +4 anomaly bonus to Constitution and a +6 anomaly bonus to Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma ability scores. No matter who this creature was, it now gains outsider type and all protean's traits. In addition, the creature gains unique defensive abilities (chaotic mind, images of chaos) and Anomaly Distortion ability. Creature gains access to the anomaly spell. Finally, the creature gains the following feats: Spell Penetration, Greater Spell Penetration, Combat Casting, Destructive Dispel.
4926aaaf-5060-440a-8b70-eb1d84f8b5a3: An Anomaly creature gets a +8 anomaly bonus to Constitution and a +4 anomaly bonus to Dexterity ability scores. No matter who this creature was, it now gains outsider type and all protean's traits. In addition, the creature gains a unique defensive ability Maelstrom's Displacement and Anomaly Distortion ability. The creature gains a +5 profane bonus to AC, a +2 profane bonus on all saving throws, and (20×CR) additional hit points. Finally, the creature gains the following feats: Deflect Arrows, Toughness.
6e3e55df-15e4-428f-9d1c-de650a60a8d0: An elemental is a being composed entirely from one of the four classical elements: air, earth, fire, or water.
218f86be-fc91-4401-9d7b-f83ff071d4d6:
An iron golem is immune to any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} that allows {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.
In addition, certain spells and effects function differently against it, as noted below.
A magical attack that deals electricity damage slows an iron golem (as the slow spell) for 3 rounds, with no saving throw.
A magical attack that deals fire damage breaks any slow effect on the golem and heals 4d8+20 points of damage.
84444212-5799-40d4-89a0-62ef2c4d8739:
An undead creature possesses the following {g|Encyclopedia:Trait}traits{/g} (unless otherwise noted in a creature's entry).
No {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score. Undead use their {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} score in place of their Constitution score when calculating {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}, Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, and any {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g} that relies on Constitution (such as when calculating a breath weapon's {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g}).
Immunity to bleed, petrification, death effects, disease, paralysis, poison, sleep effects, and stunning.
d35aa6bd-3065-450c-80ca-ad514371b845: Angels are a {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} of celestials, or good outsiders, native to the {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} Outer Planes.
bd9a10c9-69a5-4337-815e-a9abde943bdf: Anomalies receive a +5 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against polymorph effects.
03a1b419-6959-4236-8c8b-80d6416399a4: As a gift from your daemonic patrons you gain resist acid 5 and a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} made against poison and {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} effects.
94bde0b8-6ed4-478e-981b-d406c46e5699: At the start of the combat this creature gains 2d4 + HD/3 (maximum 16 in total) images, similarly as per mirror image spell.
03f17f64-8eb8-477d-bd60-8b5830eb540c: Azatas are a {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} of celestials, or good outsiders, native to chaotic {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} Outer Planes.
0760aa10-b6ce-4c03-986d-ef8844eecbca:
Creature affected by Valmallos's Iron Seal resembles more of a construct and less of itself, and thus gains most of constructs' immunities.
It gains immunity to mind-affecting effects, disease and critical hits. It also gains a +2 sacred bonus to all ability scores, spell resistance 45 and hardness 10.
The creature's attacks always deal 25 divine damage.
The creature can cast petrify and chain lightning spells.
4fe54701-0aa0-4302-8baa-f93134691ad1:
Creature affected by Valmallos's Mithral Seal resembles more of a construct and less of itself, and thus gains most of constructs' immunities.
It gains immunity to mind-affecting effects, disease and critical hits. It also gains a +4 sacred bonus to all ability scores, immunity to magic and hardness 20.
The creature's attacks always deal 50 divine damage.
The creature can cast the following spells: petrify, chain lightning, disintegrate and prediction of failure.
f60c4641-0502-485e-b675-bbb6919f923b: Creature ignores 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. It doesn't matter whether the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} has a mundane or magical source.
e55b5c25-ed09-4424-b737-cc5845a95abf: Creature ignores 10 points of sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. It doesn't matter whether the damage has a mundane or magical source.
9c603410-ce10-4d52-a304-1a8fce6454bf: Creature ignores 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. It doesn't matter whether the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} has a mundane or magical source.

632c504e-5b71-402a-b741-c327d856c5cc: Creature ignores 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. It doesn't matter whether the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} has a mundane or magical source.

1837eecd-786a-4871-ab4b-e5aff5d985b1: Creature takes half again as much (+50%) {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as normal from Acid, regardless of whether a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} is allowed or if the save is a success or failure.
c0eddd9e-0228-44a8-ae15-ef761c34d6e7: Creature takes half again as much (+50%) {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as normal from Cold, regardless of whether a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} is allowed or if the save is a success or failure.
8d849ffb-c3d7-4fbc-958b-e09489f506d4: Creature takes half again as much (+50%) {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as normal from Electricity, regardless of whether a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} is allowed or if the save is a success or failure.
96cc9143-73bc-4b87-b32d-6c3d136e5a9b: Creature takes half again as much (+50%) {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as normal from Fire, regardless of whether a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} is allowed or if the save is a success or failure.
e5f9744f-cbbf-44f9-b29c-3510cea89c93: Creature takes half again as much (+50%) {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as normal from Sonic, regardless of whether a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} is allowed or if the save is a success or failure.
5c4c5a5d-8a62-49cd-b657-11abbc17e5bc: Creatures with channel resistance gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} made against channeled energy. They add their bonus to any Will saves made to halve the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and resist the effect.
ce0dfcdc-8ccc-4f7f-be97-63556a3941a5: Daemons are neutral evil outsiders that eat souls and thrive on disaster and ruin.
f80669c0-a2a6-4a98-9ac8-49795fc03af0: Devils are lawful evil outsiders that hail from the plane of Hell.
fcd7a3b9-48e6-4e3d-af33-559c550452d5:
First time an Anomaly creature deals damage this turn, the target must pass a Will saving throw (DC = 10 + half the number of hit dice + Charisma modifier) or suffer the Anomaly Distortion effect. The effect is permanent on core difficulty or higher. Anomaly Distortion effect can be removed by a Scroll of Synchronization or by dispel magic, remove curse spells or similar abilities (in this case DC is the same).
Anomaly Distortion: You randomly suffer one of the following effects:
Reality Translocation: You suffer 2d10 slashing damage per round for 1 minute.
Body Desynchronization: You become blind, your speed is reduced by 20 feet, you suffer a -4 penalty to attack rolls and a -10 penalty to damage rolls.
Mind Desynchronization: You suffer a -5 penalty on concentration checks, a -10 penalty to spell resistance, and all your spells have a 15% chance to fail, for 1 minute.
Consciousness Malfunction: You can't tell friend from foe and start attacking the nearest creature for 1 minute.
Magic mishap: Whenever you cast a spell you suffer 4d8 slashing damage for 1d4 minutes.
b73fc889-129c-4ef6-b357-3c8e9df24289: Half-fiends are creatures heavily tainted with demonic, infernal, or other evil power.
19a4aebc-e86b-4ebd-995a-1c787de3dff7: Inevitables are construct-like outsiders built by the axiomites to enforce law.
a2cd2937-c222-40cc-ae55-688330e834c9: No matter who this creature was, it now gains outsider type and all protean's traits, such as blindsense, immunity to acid, electricity resistance 10, sonic resistance 10, fortification 25, polymorph resistance, and a constant effect of the freedom of movement spell.
2a0babda-45cf-4ae9-9d27-db7d663d7c75: Once per day, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the half-fiend can smite good as the smite evil ability of a paladin of the same level as the half-fiend's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, except affecting a good target. The smite persists until target is dead or the half-fiend rests.
7f7816de-6a30-477d-a8ee-d0d3523c0be1: Once per day, the fiendish creature may smite a {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} target. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the creature chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is good, the creature adds its {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (if any) to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} bonus equal to its HD against that foe. This effect persists until the target is dead or the creature rests.
e209bf54-d003-4131-8268-547aa59cc6cf: Psychopomps are a {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} of neutral outsiders who serve the goddess of death and oversee mortal souls.
96460b59-feb9-4385-8f19-153476adaddc: Slithering creatures of pure chaos, proteans claim they were the masters of the multiverse before the first gods created the other planes from the pure chaos of the primeval beginnings. They seek to tear down the multiverse and restore it to its original chaotic form.
e08d16c4-5fc7-4a8b-b392-dda9f5746a26: Some creatures possess blindsight, the {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}extraordinary ability{/g} to use a non-visual sense (or a combination senses) to operate effectively without vision. This makes invisibility and {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (even magical darkness) irrelevant to the creature.
a3837c36-95e4-4acb-86a3-fa891a5a7422: Swarmform creature deals {g|Encyclopedia:Physical_Damage}Physical damage{/g} plus 1.5×{g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier to target creature.
6f2b0b69-c4c1-4518-a61a-45fd5dd4cdad: Swarmform creature deals {g|Encyclopedia:Physical_Damage}Physical damage{/g} to all creatures around it every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
5f9b81f0-79a8-40f3-bda0-a4b11cf71289: The affected creature must pass a Fortitude saving throw (DC 40) or turn to stone permanently.
5b035e28-4178-4e47-867f-52bc14278fb9: The character appearance differs only slightly, making the character seem younger and more attractive. Despite being a boon in social encounters, this is bound to make the character a more alluring prey in the wilderness. The character gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used for diplomacy and bluff) {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} but suffers a -1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against Animals and Magical Beasts.
44da8b7c-97ca-4176-bb7b-14743b5371ea: The character's eyes are filled with primordial bloodlust and react to even the smallest glimpse of movement. The character gets +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used to intimidate) {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} and gains +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} bonus against Animals and Magical Beasts.
41b78083-9ec5-4d7d-a9a5-4c5b03358564: The creature can exhale a line of acid every {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, dealing 1d8 {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per point of its CR to everyone in the line.
57bddb03-de6f-4c68-903b-4bd35e6e4e0d: The creature can exhale a line of cold every {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, dealing 1d8 {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} per point of its CR to everyone in the line.
293d0c51-7274-42ee-a3a5-2cdc81e7d5e2: The creature can exhale a line of electricity every {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, dealing 1d8 {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per point of its CR to everyone in the line.
0557f188-8358-41cb-a64f-ca56094b82fe: The creature can exhale a line of fire every {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, dealing 1d8 {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per point of its CR to everyone in the line.
2f7240cd-f76d-4591-b5fa-e12cb44c8594: The creature is immune to any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} that allows {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.
8fcdbf56-b133-4e40-9d43-72d3111e6acb: The creature sees in all directions at once. It cannot be {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanked{/g}.
b2528d9b-7e58-4e89-a57b-b8b1e7c42447: The creature's body is malleable and shapeless. It is immune to precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (like sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}) and {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}.
06e6ed22-2c59-4711-acc8-882d9d5eadca: The creature's natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} increases by +1.
6cc8f067-2130-4f99-904a-f83c69c98296: The first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} of an Abyssal creature deals additional {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}Acid damage{/g} to every creature in a 15-foot cone.
38bb2e02-33fb-45b2-a126-7bcbde6bb84f: The first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} of an Abyssal creature deals additional {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}Cold damage{/g} to every creature in a 15-foot cone.
fbf89bd0-5a2a-4b6f-b497-beef7ca6d47b: The first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} of an Abyssal creature deals additional {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}Electricity damage{/g} to every creature in a 15-foot cone.
b42a2f64-ca1b-4ccc-a029-0accc5355062: The first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} of an Abyssal creature deals additional {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}Fire damage{/g} to every creature in a 15-foot cone.
8033f48b-2571-447b-bf45-f50ce14d09dd: The subject is protected from all abilities and spells that gather information about the target through divination magic (such as see invisibility, thoughtsense and true seeing).
171c27a5-d301-497e-8a15-1f445d3f74f6: The swarm takes only half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} that deal hit point damage, with the remainder taken by the flesh mansion. Because a swarm of Diminutive creatures is immune to all weapon damage, apply half of all weapon damage to the fleshy shield and ignore the half that would be applied to the swarm. When the flesh mansion reaches 0 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}, it is destroyed and the swarm functions like a normal swarm.
a206c844-5c86-445c-a9e5-195aa1b8b8ad: These creatures are monstrous abyssal insects in the form of other creatures.
93f7eac4-c6cd-4388-8cda-ff16d6b1f74f: This creature gains immunity to mind-affecting effects. Whenever any non-outsider attempts to use a mind-affecting effect against anomaly, it takes HDd6 points of unholy damage and must make a Will save or become confused for 2d4 rounds. This is a mind-affecting effect. The save DC is Charisma-based.
85914f55-f4ff-4bce-8be7-ac36b5a59eba:
This creature is particularly skilled at making {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with its {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}.
Prerequisite: Three or more natural attacks.
Benefit: The creature's secondary attacks with natural weapons take only a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g}.
Normal: Without this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, the creature's secondary attacks with natural weapons take a –5 penalty.
f7af9ad6-2452-4f3b-a638-af9ef1f429e9: This creature takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} hit point {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each turn. Bleeding can be stopped through the application of any effect that cures hit point damage (even if the bleed is {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}).
3f6ca965-bcb6-420e-8bad-9a4cd05827e8: This creature takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each turn. Bleeding can be stopped through the application of any effect that cures hit point damage (even if the bleed is {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}).
a08fa6ed-af9a-4adf-a943-ec3eeb3dce84: This creature takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} hit point {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each turn. Bleeding can be stopped through the application of any effect that cures hit point damage (even if the bleed is {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}).
2f27f6ed-6aac-4537-9100-304bfa4901ef: This creature takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} hit point {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each turn. Bleeding can be stopped through the application of any effect that cures hit point damage (even if the bleed is {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}).
2706a799-7926-4075-8248-ac7558d20ea1: This creature was deformed by Deskari's swarm. A Swarmform creature gets +4 to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, +4 to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and + 4 to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. Swarmform creature gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 15/- and fast {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} equal to it's CR. It also has all immunities that Swarms have.
ef849c05-1b52-4236-bb53-271df3c60be4: This creature's corpse has fallen prey to the ever-hungry bhoga swarm. In a few moments, there won't be a single bone left.
bda62a11-bc62-4b01-bbb7-6dc37b68a765: This subtype is applied to any creature when it is on a plane other than its native plane. A creature that travels the planes can gain or lose this subtype as it goes from plane to plane. No creature has the extraplanar subtype when it is on a transitive plane, such as the Astral Plane, the Ethereal Plane, or the Plane of Shadow.
d761c740-c532-4106-8be8-0bab141360c0: This subtype is usually applied to Outsiders native to the evil-aligned Outer Planes. Evil Outsiders are also called fiends. Most creatures that have this subtype also have evil alignments; however, if their alignments change, they still retain the subtype. Any effect that depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} affects a creature with this subtype as if the creature has an evil alignment, no matter what its alignment actually is. The creature also suffers effects according to its actual alignment. A creature with the evil subtype overcomes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} as if its {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} and any weapons it wields are evil-aligned.
4b8d7e97-2092-4493-b8ed-de4bcfcb7abb: This subtype is usually applied to outsiders native to the chaotic-aligned Outer Planes. Most creatures that have this subtype also have chaotic alignments; however, if their alignments change, they still retain the subtype. Any effect that depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} affects a creature with this subtype as if the creature had a chaotic alignment, no matter what its alignment actually is. The creature also suffers effects according to its actual alignment. A creature with the chaotic subtype overcomes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} as if its {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} and any weapons it wields are chaotically aligned.
469c1fd4-fdf8-4b8f-9481-07d850315611: This subtype is usually applied to outsiders native to the good-aligned Outer Planes. Most creatures that have this subtype also have good alignments; however, if their alignments change, they still retain the subtype. Any effect that depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} affects a creature with this subtype as if the creature has a good alignment, no matter what its alignment actually is. The creature also suffers effects according to its actual alignment. A creature with the good subtype overcomes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} as if its {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} and any weapons it wields are good-aligned.
95724dc8-2af0-4dd7-8075-6b90339c4d6a: This subtype is usually applied to outsiders native to the lawful-aligned Outer Planes. Most creatures that have this subtype also have lawful alignments; however, if their alignments change, they still retain the subtype. Any effect that depends on {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} affects a creature with this subtype as if the creature had a lawful alignment, no matter what its alignment actually is. The creature also suffers effects according to its actual alignment. A creature with the lawful subtype overcomes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} as if its {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} and any weapons it wields are lawful-aligned.
2127097e-21d5-40b0-b7ce-f36f8ed25abc: This subtype is usually used for Outsiders with a connection to the Elemental Planes of Water.
c86bf187-cb7a-4185-bfa0-4cb7a512bf3d: This subtype is usually used for outsiders with a connection to the Elemental Planes of Air.
468aba8f-2b3a-4526-a139-59bb20b54809: This subtype is usually used for outsiders with a connection to the Elemental Planes of Earth.
a21e947d-7030-45ec-af97-9797f0d28da2: Though aeons aren't {g|Encyclopedia:Incorporeal_Touch_Attack}incorporeal{/g}, their forms are only a semi-tangible manifestation of something greater. An aeon's void form grants it a deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to quarter its {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} (rounded down).
5daabf0e-6e75-48ab-8553-7ecf7a81986f: Unit has immunity to death effects.
2592898a-f8c5-475b-b752-56522ce60861: Vampires are undead humanoid creatures that feed on the blood of the living. They look much as they did in life, often becoming more attractive, though some have a hardened, feral look instead.
990fb101-3de5-4910-b208-a86a01a57a80: When a demodand's {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g} or melee weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} a creature capable of casting divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, that creature must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} or be unable to cast any divine spells for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Once a creature makes this save, it is immune to further faith-stealing strikes from that particular demodand for 24 hours. The save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}-based.
a5397893-1926-4c35-8a4a-87ef53f6fe4b: When the flesh mansion starts its turn no more than 5 feet from a corpse, the swarm pounces on the orphaned meat and begins to rebuild the flesh mansion. This restores 5 hit points per the corpse's size category, starting with Small.
4fc7c9bb-b5f5-4ba5-8d9d-fbed42a9dac9: Whenever an enemy deals damage in melee against such creature, there is a 50% chance for that enemy to suffer 2d10 sonic damage. That enemy must make a successful Fortitude saving throw or become stunned for 1 round.
1bf02026-5fa7-40b0-8709-88fedafa954c: Whenever such creature is targeted by a spell or is caught within the area of effect of a spell, it can, as an immediate action, choose to teleport to an area adjacent to the spell's caster, effectively appearing mid-leap and aimed toward the caster. This ability takes effect regardless of whether or not the spell overcomes the spell resistance. Such creature can immediately make a full attack against the spell's caster as though pouncing. Using this ability does not provoke an attack of opportunity
17fefcaf-a1a3-4ede-8843-efd724dbdd57: Whenever the Anomaly casters use their spell or spell-like ability this Anomaly Spell ability randomly simulates one of the following spells, cast in a selective way as if they had the Selective Metamagic feat, with a Will saving throw (DC 40): energy drain; tsunami; weird; polar ray; insanity; chain lightning; elemental assessor. Alternatively, it might summon 1d4+1 Keketars to assist in the fight.
d6336aa0-9f24-4986-bac9-fa75f5463e98:
Whenever you cast a spell you suffer 4d8 unholy damage.
Anomaly Distortion effect can be removed by a Scroll of Synchronization or by dispel magic, remove curse spells or similar abilities, in that case DC is 10 + half the number of hit dice + Charisma modifier.
06c1f69b-78d6-4d2a-bdf6-07cad9412422: While in combat this creature is under a displacement spell effect.
9582b74a-c6a0-4a16-9fac-651a431b6c2b: Will-o'-wisps have the ability to extinguish their natural glow as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, effectively becoming invisible, as per the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
d310dd2d-78e5-447a-8bb0-0aeb11257c1e:
You become blind, your speed is reduced by 20 feet, you suffer a -4 penalty to attack rolls and a -10 penalty to damage rolls.
Anomaly Distortion effect can be removed by a Scroll of Synchronization or by dispel magic, remove curse spells or similar abilities, in that case DC is 10 + half the number of hit dice + Charisma modifier.
59dd2f37-980c-4c78-8546-da7417e51f59:
You can't tell friend from foe and start attacking the nearest creature.
Anomaly Distortion effect can be removed by a Scroll of Synchronization or by dispel magic, remove curse spells or similar abilities, in that case DC is 10 + half the number of hit dice + Charisma modifier.
988e4ed1-4b47-495f-857b-a7233d552bcd: You gain a +2 profane bonus to Constitution ability score, +2 bonus to natural armor, immunity to diseases, and have a 50% chance to treat any critical hit or sneak attack as a normal hit. Due to the unpleasant stench and appearance your Charisma permanently decreases by 4.
a396cdfd-ba54-4ffd-9be6-22904d937bdc:
You suffer 2d10 unholy damage per round.
Anomaly Distortion effect can be removed by a Scroll of Synchronization or by dispel magic, remove curse spells or similar abilities, in that case DC is 10 + half the number of hit dice + Charisma modifier.
95490df0-6c68-4595-a500-316ae5be5fff:
You suffer a -5 penalty on concentration checks, a -10 penalty to spell resistance, and all your spells have a 15% chance to fail.
Anomaly Distortion effect can be removed by a Scroll of Synchronization or by dispel magic, remove curse spells or similar abilities, in that case DC is 10 + half the number of hit dice + Charisma modifier.
a7b4db3e-339c-42a1-8777-1afe3bdd3dea: You take no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from non-magic weapons, you also take only half damage from any source which deals neither ghost, holy, divine, or {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}force damage{/g}.
847a4e7d-b53c-4684-92b8-0875c19a5316: {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attacks{/g} of Treant creature are extremely strong and have a chance to stun an opponent. Once each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, when Treant Creature hits an opponent, that opponent must {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} Fortitude against the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 10+HD/2+{g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g} Mod or become stunned for one round.
6887b624-c451-406e-94b3-4340bcdaf935: {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attacks{/g} of Treant creature are extremely strong and have a chance to stun an opponent. Once each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, when Treant Creature hits an opponent, that opponent must {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} Fortitude against the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 10+HD/2+{g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g} Mod or become stunned for one round.
8f21163f-2c83-4bb2-9ed0-4af69a6b7a91:
{g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 18)
Onset: 1 day
Frequency: 1/day
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, 1d6 {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} damage and fatigue
{g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Cure{/g}: 3 consecutive saves
The save DC is Constitution-based.
